body:
As noted by @MarcoFalke in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18994#discussion_r426250850 the case can be made that at least some of the functions in our code base returning `const char*` should return `std::string` instead.

Candidates:

```
$ git grep -E '^(static |inline |const |unsigned )*char *\*[^(<]*\(' ":(exclude)src/leveldb/" ":(exclude)src/univalue/" ":(exclude)src/serialize.h" ":(exclude)src/tinyformat.h"
src/bitcoin-cli.cpp:static const char *http_errorstring(int code)
src/script/script.cpp:const char* GetOpName(opcodetype opcode)
src/script/script.h:const char* GetOpName(opcodetype opcode);
src/script/script_error.cpp:const char* ScriptErrorString(const ScriptError serror)
src/script/script_error.h:const char* ScriptErrorString(const ScriptError error);
src/script/standard.cpp:const char* GetTxnOutputType(txnouttype t)
src/script/standard.h:const char* GetTxnOutputType(txnouttype t);
src/test/script_tests.cpp:static const char *FormatScriptError(ScriptError_t err)
```

title: Investigate where std::string should be returned instead of "const char*"
